original_title: Foreign Minister seeks help from Myanmar counterpart for release Sri Lankans held hostage by terror group
original_body_lines: Foreign Minister Ali Sabry contacted the Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Foreign Affairs of Myanmar U Than Swe by telephone on Wednesday afternoon (03 Jan.), to further discuss the issue of 56 Sri Lankan nationals who are currently being held in the Myawaddy area in Myanmar.
During the conversation, Minister Sabry sought the assistance and urgent intervention of the Government of Myanmar in having the group of Sri Lankans released immediately.
The Foreign Minister also requested his Myanmar counterpart to make every possible effort to ensure the safety and well-being of the Sri Lankan nationals who are being held in this manner.
Minister Sabry discussed the matter with Minster U Than Swe once before previously, on the sidelines of the BIMSTEC Foreign Minister’s Retreat held in Bangkok recently.
Issuing a release in this regard, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs said:

“The Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Myanmar continue to actively seek the assistance and cooperation of the Myanmar authorities on the safe repatriation of Sri Lankan nationals who have been trafficked to Myanmar.
As per the information available to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, 56 Sri Lankan nationals are being illegally held in Myawaddy area as victims of human trafficking for cybercrimes.
The Ministry continues to explore all possible avenues to ensure the safety and security of Sri Lankans and seek early repatriation in consultation with the Government of Myanmar”.
